articles.title: Wi-Fi Issues
articles.content: Check airplane mode, restart your router, update network adapter drivers.

articles.title: Printer Problems
articles.content: Ensure the printer is powered on, check the connection, reinstall the driver.

articles.title: Slow Computer
articles.content: Close background apps, remove unused programs, scan for malware.

articles.title: How to install Windows 11
articles.content: Have a wiped USB drive, download Windows Installation Media, ensure USB has top boot priority in the BIOS, plug in the USB.

articles.title: Email Not Sending
articles.content: Check internet connection, verify SMTP settings, ensure email account credentials are correct, and restart your email client.

articles.title: Forgot Windows Password
articles.content: Use a password reset disk if available, try using another admin account, or boot into safe mode to reset the password.

articles.title: Software Installation Error
articles.content: Check system requirements, ensure no conflicting software is running, run installer as administrator, and check for updates.

articles.title: Blue Screen Error
articles.content: Note the error code, check for recently installed drivers or updates, run memory diagnostics, and scan for malware.

articles.title: Computer Wont Turn On
articles.content: Ensure power cable is plugged in, check power outlet, remove battery (if laptop) and retry, and reset the power supply if needed.

articles.title: Slow Internet
articles.content: Restart your modem/router, check for bandwidth-heavy apps, ensure firmware is updated, and contact your ISP if issue persists.

articles.title: Remove Windows and Install Linux Mint
articles.content: Back up all your data, create a bootable USB with Linux Mint, boot from the USB, choose to erase the disk and install Linux Mint, follow the installation prompts, then reboot.

articles.title: Browser Crashing
articles.content: Clear cache and cookies, disable extensions, update your browser, or reinstall if necessary.

articles.title: Overheating Laptop
articles.content: Clean dust from vents, ensure proper airflow, check for background processes using CPU, and replace thermal paste if needed.

articles.title: Lost Files Recovery
articles.content: Check recycle bin, use file recovery software, or restore from backup.

articles.title: USB Drive Not Recognized
articles.content: Try a different USB port, check device manager for driver issues, format the drive if necessary, and ensure file system compatibility.

articles.title: Linux Mint Installation Issues
articles.content: Verify ISO checksum, create a proper bootable USB, disable secure boot if needed, and check hardware compatibility before installing.

articles.title: Antivirus Not Updating
articles.content: Check internet connection, verify subscription status, restart antivirus service, or reinstall the software.

articles.title: Password Management
articles.content: Use strong and unique passwords, consider using a password manager, enable two-factor authentication whenever possible.
